title: [JuliaLowering] Avoid creating global binding for keyword slurp argument
body:
When `use_ssa_kw_temps=false` (i.e., when a keyword default depends on another keyword name), `kw_val_vars` was set to `kw_names` which included the slurp argument. Since the slurp argument is passed via `remaining_kws`, including it in `kw_val_vars` caused:
1. The slurp name to be referenced as an unbound `Identifier` in kwcall
2. Scope analysis resolving it as a global binding
3. The call to body method having an extra argument

This fix excludes the slurp argument from `kw_val_vars` when `has_kw_slurp=true`, since it's always the last element of `kw_names`.

IR change in kwcall method for `f(; a=1, b=a, kws...) = (a, b, kws)`:

Before:

    22  TestMod.#f#0
    23  slot₅/a
    24  slot₆/b
    25  Main.kws                                    # unwanted global
    26  (call %₂₂ %₂₃ %₂₄ %₂₅ %₂₁ slot₃/#self#)    # extra argument

After:

    22  TestMod.#f#0
    23  slot₅/a
    24  slot₆/b
    25  (call %₂₂ %₂₃ %₂₄ %₂₁ slot₃/#self#)        # correct

This fix is important not only for the correctness of the IR generated by JuliaLowering, but also it eliminates false positive undefined global variable reports that JETLS would report for cases like the following:
```julia
function f_kw_slurp_dep(; a=1, b=a, kws...)
    (a, b, kws)
end
```
